alert.note: Alert for Benton; Carroll (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 10 at 8:03AM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern Benton, northwestern Madison, Carroll, Crawford, northwestern Sebastian, Washington, east central Haskell, eastern Sequoyah, southeastern Adair and northeastern Le Flore Counties through 845 AM CDT... At 803 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 4 miles east of Beaver to 3 miles northwest of Bokoshe. Movement was east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down small tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations in or near the path include... Fort Smith... Fayetteville... Springdale... Van Buren... Sallisaw... Berryville... Huntsville... Eureka Springs... Cedarville... Mountainburg... Natural Dam... Lowell... Farmington... Alma... Prairie Grove... Pocola... Muldrow... Roland... Elkins... West Fork... This includes the following highways, Interstate 40 in Arkansas between mile markers 0 and 13. Interstate 40 in Oklahoma between mile markers 308 and 328. Interstate 540 between mile markers 1 and 14. Interstate 49 between mile markers 22 and 73. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Persons in campgrounds should consider seeking sturdy shelter until these storms pass.
